newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Updated details of Russian Eurobond issues.
newsitem.headline: Updated details of Russian Eurobond issues.

text.p: UES mandated Deutsche Morgan Grenfell and Renaissance Capital to lead-manage its debut eurobond of at least $200 million.
The Samara region mandated Goldman Sachs to lead-manage its Eurobond.
ISSUED:

UNEXIMBANK - July 1997; $200 million, three years; August 1, 2000; 400 bp over three-year U.S. Treasuries; coupon 9.875 pct;issue/reoffer prices 99.81 pct;leads Merrill Lynch and ICFI (MFK); IBCA BB; Moody's Ba3;

ALFA-BANK - July 16, 1997; $175 million; July 28, 2000; 475 bp over 6.375 pct May 2000 U.S. Treasuries; issue price is 99.625 pct; coupon 10.375 pct; Goldman Sachs; Moody's B1, Standard & Poor's single B, IBCA BB minus.

SBS-AGRO (STOLICHNY BANK SBEREGENY) - July 8, 1997; $200 million; three years; July 21, 2000; priced to yield 425 bp 6.375 U.S. Treasuries (May 2000); coupon 10.25 pct; re-offer price 99.25 pct; leads JP Morgan Securities; July 10, 1997-additional tranche; $50 million; priced to yield 420 bp over 6.375 May 2000 U.S Treasuries; Moody's B1, S&P B+, IBCA long-term BB, short-term B, individual D, legal 2T.

RUSSIAN FEDERATION - June 1997; $2.0 bln; June 26, 2007; priced to yield 375 bp over 6.625 pct U.S Treasuries (May 15, 2007); annual coupon 10.00 pct; re-offer price is 99.164 pct; leads J.P. Morgan Securities, SBC Warburg

ST PETERSBURG - June 1997; $300 million; May 2002; priced to yield 312.5 bp over five-year U.S. Treasuries (May 2002); leads Salomon Brothers; coupon 9.50 pct; S&P BB-, IBCA BB+ for long-term investment, B for short-term investment; road-show on May 23; IBCA rated the issue at BB+ for long-term investment, S&P assigned BB- for long-term foreign currency debt

CITY OF MOSCOW - May 1997, $500 million May 2000; priced to yield 315 bp over 6.375 pct three-year U.S Treasuries (May 2000); leads CS First Boston, Nomura International; coupon 9.50 pct; Moody's Ba2, Standard & Poor's BB-

RUSSIAN FEDERATION - March 1997, 2.0 billion marks, seven years (maturing March 25, 2004); leads Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, CS First Boston; coupon 9.0 pct, priced to yield 370 basis points over seven-year (March 2004) German government bonds; S&P BB-

RUSSIAN FEDERATION - November 1996, $1 billion, five years (maturing November 27, 2001); leads JP Morgan, SBC Warburg; coupon 9.25 pct, priced to yield 345 bp over five-year U.S. Treasuries (5.875 pct notes due November 30, 2001); Moody's Ba2, S&P BB-, IBCA BB+
PLANNED:
SOVEREIGN

RUSSIAN FEDERATION - may decide not to issue another Eurobond in 1997; up to $3.5 bln in total 1997 borrowing; plans to apply for permission to make a global bond issue this autumn, likely to be dollar-denominated; dealers estimated the volume to be between $500 million and $1.0 bln
RUSSIAN FEDERATION - rouble Eurobond in 1998
RUSSIAN FEDERATION - $3.0-$3.5 bln through three Eurobond issues in 1998. One issue likely to be yen-denominated.
REGIONS AND MUNICIPALITIES
CHELYABINSK - $100 million
IRKUTSK REGION - early 1998, $80 million; leads ING-Barings; advisers All-Russian Bank for Regional Development (agent), ING-Barings (ratings consultant)
KOMI REPUBLIC - $200 million, five years; SBC Warburg (rating consultant)
MARY EL REPUBLIC - likely to drop Eurobond plans
MOSCOW (CITY) - plans a $500 million Eurobond at the end of September or start of October; between five and 10 years.
MOSCOW (REGION) - up to $400 million, three to five years; lead SBC Warburg; expects ratings from Moody's and IBCA in June
NIZHNY NOVGOROD - up to $100 million July 1997; five-years; Moody's Ba2, S&P BB-; leads ING-Barings
PERM REGION - $150- $200 million in December or January; lead Morgan Stanley; Moody's and S&P work on the rating
SAMARA REGION - up to $500 million; autumn; Goldman Sachs
SVERDLOVSK - October 1997; $100 million, three-five years (plans total $300 million over several years); leads WestMerchant Bank, Inkombank (adviser/co-manager)
TATARSTAN REPUBLIC - ING Barings; $200 million minimum; September or October; 3-5 yrs with a fixed-rate coupon
SAKHA REPUBLIC (YAKUTIA) - several Eurobond issues; lead manager to be chosen by end of June
ORYOL - $100 million within three years; $35-$40 initial tranche; talks to Societe Generale to be the lead; All-Russian Bank for Regional Development and Bank Derzhava to advise
LENINGRAD REGION - plans to get a credit rating
SAKHALIN REGION - in cooperation with Inkombank
ASTRAKHAN REGION - $100 million; 1998
NOVOSIBIRSK REGION - to decide by Sept 1 whether to issue
CORPORATE
ALMAZY ROSSII-SAKHA (ARS) - $350 million by end of 1997; SBC Warburg, Smith Barney; 3-5 years
GAZ - autumn of 1997; Credit Suisse (adviser)
GAZPROM - $1 bln in unsecured Eurobond issue during 1997, or start of 1998; ABN-Amro rating consultant; $1 bln in Eurobond secured by gas exports; Dresdner Kleinwort Benson rating consultant
KAMAZ - about $100 million by the end of 1997
LUKOIL - 1998 at earliest; Standard & Poor's BB-
MGTS - second half of 1997; $150 million, three to five years, 9.5 pct; leads CS First Boston, Salomon Bros; expects rating in September
MOSENERGO - late 2nd qtr/early 3rd qtr 1997, $150 million, about five years; lead Salomon Bros; S&P BB-
RED OCTOBER - about $25-$27 million; CS First Boston; three years; private placement; K.O. Finansy (adviser); 1997
ROSTELEKOM - S&P BB-
TATNEFT - $200-$300 million, Sept-Oct 1997; leads Dresdner Kleinwort Benson
UES - at least $200 million; 1997; Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, Renaissance Capital
SIBNEFT - dollar-denominated, to be launched on August 1 via Salomon Brothers; bankers say to be priced at three-month dollar LIBOR plus 400 bp.
BANKS
INKOMBANK - mid-1997, two-three years
NATSIONALNY REZERVNY BANK - rating in 1997
PROMSTROIBANK ST PETERSBURG - 1997, $50-$100 million, working with CS First Boston
--Moscow Newsroom, +7095 941 8520
